result.execSummary:
The defendant Krystal Marie Huck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $10,052.82 and restitution surcharge of $1,005.28 for a total of $11,058.10.

Bonds forfeited and applied to restitution.
Search for employment commensurate with disability and complies with SSDI program limitations.

Submit to an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

No contact with victims L.V.H., D.D. or their residences.  No contact with Tomah Wal-Mart.

Write a letter of apology to D.D., victim in 15CM256, and submit to agent for approval.

Random drug testing as deemed appropriate by agent.

Cooperate with home county child support agency to pursue child support to help meet the needs of her children and herself.

No consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages.  No entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances not legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as  directed to be taken.

Psychological evaluation and comply with counseling recommendations.

No drug paraphernalia.

supervisions.notes:
9/15/22 - JOC amended per letter dated 9/15/22 to reflect 385 days of sentence credit and 2 yrs extended supervision.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. 
Concurrent with 16CF587, 16CF588, & 16CF629

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $3,302.82 and restitution surcharge of
$1,005.28 for a total of $4,308.10

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended. 
Defendant to undergo Psych evaluation and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended. 
No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's name. 
Take prescribed medications as directed by a licensed physician. 
No drug paraphernalia. 
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose. Obtain/Maintain employment or education as approved per agent. May be a combination of education and employment. 
Obtain/Maintain housing as approved per agent. Any conditions, no contacts, and assessments per agent. 
Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
